initWithLayout

Initializes an instance of this class with the specified layout, file name, and rolling frequency.

initWithLayout:fileName:rollingFrequency:
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout fileName :

initWithLayout:fileName:rollingFrequency:

Initializes an instance of this class with the specified layout, file name, and rolling frequency.
See Also:
initWithLayout
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout fileName :
        (NSString *) aName rollingFrequency :
        (L4RollingFrequency ) rollingFrequency;
Parameter Descriptions
aLayout
The layout object for this appender
aName
The file path to the file in which you want logging output recorded
rollingFrequency
The frequency at which you want the log file rolled over
method result
An initialized instance of this class

rollingFrequency

Returns this object's rolling frequency. 
( L4RollingFrequency ) rollingFrequency;
method result
This object's rolling frequency

setRollingFrequency

Sets the object's rolling frequency
See Also:
setRollingFrequency:
( void ) setRollingFrequency:
        (L4RollingFrequency ) rollingFrequency;

setRollingFrequency:

Sets the object's rolling frequency
See Also:
setRollingFrequency
( void ) setRollingFrequency:
        (L4RollingFrequency ) rollingFrequency;
Parameter Descriptions
rollingFrequency
The desired rolling frequency for this object

subAppend

See Also:
subAppend:
( void ) subAppend:
        (L4LoggingEvent *) event;

This method overrides the implementation in L4WriterAppender. It checks if the rolling frequency has been exceeded. If so, it rolls the file over.

subAppend:

See Also:
subAppend
( void ) subAppend:
        (L4LoggingEvent *) event;

This method overrides the implementation in L4WriterAppender. It checks if the rolling frequency has been exceeded. If so, it rolls the file over.

Parameter Descriptions
event
An L4LoggingEvent that contains logging specific information

(Last Updated 4/29/2004)
